IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A CARING ENVIRONMENT WHERE MOTIVATED STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DIFFERENCES DISCOVER THEIR UNIQUE PATHS TO PERSONAL AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE IN PREPARATION FOR A SUCCESSFUL COLLEGE EXPERIENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A CARING ENVIRONMENT WHERE MOTIVATED STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DIFFERENCES DISCOVER THEIR UNIQUE PATHS TO PERSONAL AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE IN PREPARATION FOR A SUCCESSFUL COLLEGE EXPERIENCE.
IRS990.Desc: ASSISTING STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DIFFERENCES TO EXCEL PERSONALLY AND ACADEMICALLY AND TO PREPARE THEM FOR A SUCCESSFUL COLLEGE EXPERIENCE (239 ENROLLED STUDENTS).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE MISSION OF CAMP FUNTIME IS TO PROVIDE A WELL ROUNDED SUMMER PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN, ENABLING THEM TO LEARN NEW SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE PERSONAL GROWTH IN A SAFE AND SECURE ENVIRONMENT. THERE WERE 321 CAMPERS DURING THE SUMMER 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT ASSETS INCLUDE DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS THAT THE SCHOOL MUST HOLD IN PERPETUITY. THE PRINCIPAL IS INVESTED FOR LONG-TERM GROWTH TO SERVICE . PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF STUDENTS. THE INCOME FROM ENDOWMENT FUND IS APPROPRIATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT SPENDING POLICY AND IS USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS.

THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) SECTION 501(C)(3) AND THE CORRESPONDING PROVISIONS OF THE CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE. WHILE THE ORGANIZATION IS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE IRC, INCOME DETERMINED TO BE UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME (UBI) WOULD BE TAXABLE. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATES UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THROUGH ITS REVIEW OF THE SOURCES OF INCOME TO IDENTIFY UBI AND CERTAIN OTHER MATTERS, INCLUDING THOSE WHICH MAY AFFECT ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THE EFFECT OF THE UNCERTAINTY WOULD BE RECORDED IF THE OUTCOME WAS CONSIDERED PROBABLE AND REASONABLY ESTIMABLE. AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING ACCRUAL. THE ORGANIZATION FILES FEDERAL AND CALIFORNIA EXEMPT ORGANIZATION RETURNS. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR THE YEARS BEFORE 2013 FOR FEDERAL AND 2012 FOR STATE TAX FILINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART XI, LINE 4B OTHER ADJUSTMENTS CONSIST OF (1) SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED OF 1,126,491 THAT ARE NETTED AGAINST TUITION REVENUE IN THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PART XII, LINE 4B OTHER ADJUSTMENTS CONSIST OF (1) SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED OF 1,126,491 THAT ARE NETTED AGAINST TUITION REVENUE IN THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

WESTMARK SCHOOL PROVIDES TUITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM WHICH ENABLES STUDENTS WHOSE FAMILIES NEED FINANCIAL AID TO ATTEND THE SCHOOL WHEN THEY MIGHT NOT OTHERWISE BE ABLE TO DO SO. WESTMARK SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID POLICY IS ADMINISTERED AND GUIDED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOL'S (NAIS) STANDARDS OF GOOD PRACTICE. AID IS AWARDED BASED ON EACH FAMILY'S DEMONSTRATED NEED, WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL AND ETHNIC ORIGIN, OR GENDER. DETAILED FINANCIAL AID RECORDS (INCLUDING APPLICATIONS AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS) ARE KEPT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCHOOL'S DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY.
PART I, LINE 1A - FRINGE OR EXPENSE EXPLANATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT, THE SCHOOL PROVIDES HOUSING TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.
THE DRAFT IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD PRIOR TO SUBMISSION.
MANAGEMENT MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE ON A REGULAR BASIS.

EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. BENCHMARKING INFORMATION IS OBTAINED VIA NAIS STATS ONLINE, ISBOA, AND NBOA. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND RECOMMENDED TO THE FULL BOARD (INDEPENDENT MEMBERS) FOR APPROVAL.

OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES COMPENSATION AND WAGES OVER 100,000 ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. BENCHMARKING INFORMATION IS OBTAINED VIA NAIS STATS ONLINE, CISBOA, AND NBOA. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND RECOMMENDED TO THE FULL BOARD (INDEPENDENT MEMBERS) FOR APPROVAL.
